Cicero spends the first half of the year in Pompey's camp at Dyrrachium, where he conceives a poor opinion of Pompey’s army3 he is still there when he hears of the utter defeat of Pompcy by Caesar near Pharsalus on August 7 and his ssight to Egypt.
